entry.title: iwa: Make dev mode stricter
entry.content:
When dev mode is enabled, do not automatically trust _all_ signing keys.

Instead, just automatically trust signing keys of dev mode apps. This

makes sure that apps installed outside of dev mode, which then lost

trust, are not suddenly trusted again when enabling dev mode.



Also, the reader registry now splits its cache based on whether the

bundle is accessed as a dev mode bundle or not. In the unlikely case

that, for some reason, the same bundle is accessed as a dev mode and

prod mode bundle, it being trusted as a dev mode bundle will not

automatically make it trusted as a prod mode bundle.



These changes mean that tests which enable the dev mode flag, but then

install non-dev-mode bundles, now need to explicitly trust the signing

keys of these bundles.



For the `IsolatedWebAppResponseReaderFactory` in particular, I opted to

not add another boolean but instead rely on a `base::EnumSet` to

hopefully prevent accidentally confusing the two booleans with each

other.



Fixed: 40254511, 272716897

Change-Id: I6bfc75c128e5d875d14924a830a1d1315c1880d1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317618

entry.title: [infra] Rename spec_type to spec_handler.
entry.content:
There is an overuse of the word type within the targets starlark code:

it's used to refer to things that aren't really types in the programming

sense and conveys little about what the objects do. The change to

handler conveys marginally more information about what the objects do

since at least it's clear that the spec type isn't the spec itself, but

also removes any ambiguity about programming language types.

entry.title: Annotate dangling pointers with Include-Ci-Only-Tests
entry.content:
We observed several unrelated failure on the Dawn autoroller, due to the

dangling pointers detector.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334912?tab=checks



This is caused by them using:

Include-Ci-Only-Tests: true



Outside of Linux, the dangling pointer detector is only running on the

CQ. So this option is creating an new unforced configuration.



The permanent solution would be to enforce DPD by default on every

platforms. This patch is only a temporary solution to help with the

roll.

entry.title: Improve intentional-browser-crash identifier
entry.content:
If a user navigates to chrome://inducebrowsercrashforrealz then they

will, not surprisingly, crash the browser process. This has recently

been done a lot when testing the crash system on the ARM64 Windows

version of Chrome.



Unfortunately Google's crash system labels these crashes with

content::HandleDebugURL which makes it not obvious that the crash was

actually requested. And, it means that any actual crash in this function

(unlikely) would be conflated with the intentional crashes.



The fix is easy: move the crash to a separate function and tag it as

NOINLINE. The same logic applies to HangCurrentThread so I tagged it as

NOINLINE as well.



HandleDebugURL has had at least twelve bugs filed against it over the

years. Maybe this will prevent future ones.



to confirm that this change fixes the call stack.



Test: Manually crashed the browser (release build) and used the debugger

Bug: 40839653

Change-Id: Icf7ebf2b91fb4323df1da63fc86289839a03955a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334277

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

Commit-Queue: Bruce Dawson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267177}

entry.title: utr: Wrap recipes.py invocations in `rdb stream`
entry.content:
The chromium recipe needs an rdb invocation in its context so that it

can fetch the results of any tests it triggers. (The chromium recipe

migrated away from json test results a while ago.)



So this has the utr wrap recipe invocations in

`rdb stream -new -- ...` which will create an rdb invocation for the

duration of the recipe. It also adds some checking for rdb auth

to improve UX in case the user isn't auth'ed beforehand.



Bug: 41492688

doesn't change.

entry.title: [Fast Pair][Software Scanning] Modify FastPairEnabledProvider
entry.content:
Modify the FastPairEnabledProvider class to take

a ScanningEnabledProvider as an input. Consider ScanningEnabledProvider

state only if fast-pair-software-scanning-support flag is enabled.



Edit the unit testing file: remove redundant parametrized testing, add

tests for null inputs to FastPairEnabledProvider.



Edit the ScanningEnabledProvider to not crash if local state is not

initialized: instead, is_enabled() will always return false.

This allows unrelated unit tests in ash to initialize

a FeatureStatusTracker instance without initializing local state

and not crash.

entry.title: [iOS non modal promo] Fixing incorrect histogram impression count values
entry.content:
Fixed incorrect histogram impression count values for the non modal

promo by caching the current impression count before writing or logging

histograms. Made one util function public, cached the values of both

non-modal and fullscreen promos, and made the NOTREACHED() not fatal

until M126 to validate the fix. The value is cached when the promo is

to be shown. This is due to some timing issues in the non-modal promo

which could cause the impression count value to be erroneously

incremented multiple times for 1 impression.

entry.title: [gc] Make FontFamily immutable.
entry.content:
Previously we'd build up font-family lists front to back, but would

need to mutate them to do so. Instead just build them backwards.



This removes a bunch of problematic APIs (like AppendFamily - which

doesn't append), and simplifies the code.



This will help avoid atomic write barriers once converted to oilpan.

entry.title: [PWA] Default manifest on all pages, better manifest url change.
entry.content:
This patch makes sure that the manifest_id_ field of the

AppBannerManager is always correctly re-populated after a manifest url

change, and ensures the default manifest is always correctly populated

if there is no linked manifest.



Part of this refactors the way the AppBannerManager restarts when the

manifest URL changes, to restart the pipeline in a more thorough way.

entry.title: Cleanup: Format <optional> include order.
entry.content:
This is an automated patch. Please avoid assigning unrelated bug.

#cleanup



This is a follow-up to @thestig comment:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5009410/7/pdf/accessibility_helper.cc#11



Several developers, including myself rewrote optional without properly

reordering the #includes at the beginning.

This patches automatically fixes it.



Script:

-------



```

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep -v \

-e "*win*" \

-e "third_party/*" \

-e "tools/*" \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}



replace "#include " ""

git add -u

git commit -m "remove optional"

git revert HEAD --no-commit

git add -u

echo "Formatting":

echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git add -u

git cl format --upstream=HEAD

git checkout origin/main -- ".clang-format"

git add -u

git commit -m "revert with format"

git reset --soft origin/main

git add -u

git commit -m "Automated format"

```



cleanup: This is a no-op patch formatting includes.

Bug: 40288126

Change-Id: I5f61b1207c097a4c6b20a034f9d1b323975b1851

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5335142

Owners-Override: Lei Zhang

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: Shorten uses of "side_panel::customize_chrome::mojom::" with using
entry.content:
To make wallpaper_search_handler.cc more readable, this CL adds using directives for places where:

1. The variable name is incongruent with the mojom definition i.e. thumbnail = ...WallpaperSearchResult versus mojo_descriptor_a = ...::DescriptorA::New().

2. There is no variable name to derive clarity from i.e. std::move(callback).Run(WallpaperSearchStatus::kRequestThrottled, std::vector());

entry.title: [ios] Make basic content shell process render content
entry.content:
Reuse the MachPortRendezvous code for iOS, but each content

process launch will instantiate its own server and there will

only be one set of ports registered for it. This avoids the

bootstrap code that isn't used on iOS and binds the mach send

port to the one passed across the initial XPC connection.



The motivation behind this is that we've been running the

rendezvous code on Mac for some time and we'd ideally like

to have common code passing the initial shared memory and

ports across on MacOS and iOS.



Introduce the handling of command line args and the initial

bootstrap mach send port across the initial XPC connection

with the renderer.



In summary, process launches and content renderers in the simulator.

It is untested on a device since I do not have a setup

that allows that.

entry.title: [safe_browsing] Diagnostics for profile destruction crash
entry.content:
DownloadMetadataManager::ManagerContext::Detach removes the context as

an observer of all Downloaditems in a profile's DownloadManager and then

deletes itself if there is no pending work. In some cases, it is still

observing at least one DownloadItem. In this change, we extend the

lifetime of the context in this case until it receives an

OnDownloadDestroyed notification from the last DownloadItem. During this

extended-lifetime period, we send up diagnostic dumps when observer

methods are called on the surprise DownloadItem. With luck, this will

help us understand either how a DownloadItem has escaped its

DownloadManager or how the context observed a DownloadItem belonging to

a different DownloadManager.



Bug: 40072145

Change-Id: I92b4e5e83a8e6a247cc474628d94590f6dcc7be8

entry.title: [Reauth] Fix crash for mandatory reauth switch
entry.content:
Can reproduce if clicking the toggle multiple times in a very short

time (0.5s) before the device unlock is triggered. So when this check

happens, the switch UI's value may be same as the user preference's

value if the switch is being tapped multiple times.



A straightforward fix is to simply remove this CHECK as this is not

relevant: We record the original user preference value and do a device

unlock and update the toggle to the most up-to-date value, so the UI

state during this process does not really matter.



Bug: b/325608728

entry.title: [PWA] Fix icons for Mac universal links in intent picker bubble, change behavior
entry.content:
This CL does the following:



Fixes the issue where icons on the intent picker bubble would not be shown due to non-integration with the Mac system for apps with

universal links. This is done by caching the obtained mac

information in the WebAppsIntentPickerDelegate for use when

looking for an app icon for Mac apps. On a side note, this brings

the behavior of the Mac apps closer to PWAs by making the final

callback be posted on the task runner instead of running it

synchronously.



Brings the behavior for Mac apps closer to PWAs, where:

a. If there is only 1 Mac app available, then the app icon shows

up in the intent picker bubble if link capturing is enabled. Clicking

on it directly launches the app instead of opening the bubble.

b. Otherwise, the bubble opens with all icons loaded.



Also modifies the default link capturing interactive ui tests to

verify this behavior.



Intent Chip screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BCrqRdQ6EFEpmr7

Bubble fix screenshot:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Ly8MCwXBsDTv5W



Bug: 325743930, crbug.com/1412856

dexterity.

entry.title: Add a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage
entry.content:
Part 1 of 2 for "Allow incremental adoption of -Wunsafe-buffer-usage

at a per-file (either header or source file) granularity."



A key difficulty of spanification is that of incremental application

of the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage warning:

* First, textual includes mean that it's not possible to turn on the

warning for a header file only. It has to be enabled for a cc file at

a time.

* Then, enabling it for a cc file also transitively applies it to every

header it touches.

* And, enabling it on separate cc files requires splitting up our GN

build targets quite awkwardly, and will require a huge amount of

churn.



Clang itself does not provide a way to specify a warning should be

enabled only for certain files (crbug.com/41497066).



So we introduce the 'unsafe-buffers' plugin. It enables

unsafe-buffer-usage at the "Remark" level. This means that the

remarks generated do not get counted toward the number of warnings

or errors, and can't break compilation. Then, it watches for the

remarks, and if they occurred in a file that is opted into

unsafe-buffers checks, it re-emits the Remark as an Error (and

any Notes attached to the Remark get eaten and re-emitted as

Notes in order to maintain ordering).



The result is that we can control whether unsafe-buffer-usage

errors occur based on which file it is emitted from, including

at the per-header-file granularity.



Notably, this does not involve any additional AST walks, as we

enable the warning for the DiagnosticsEngine that clang is using

during compilation and let it find the errors.



The follow-up CL will enable the plugin and integrate it into the

build and remote execution.



Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510

Change-Id: Ie540dc9ab3ae73554403924531dc2ff3ba7c8e09

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323341

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: danakj

entry.title: privacy-hub: Tie Play Store reinstall location ToS to PH pref
entry.content:
Privacy Hub project introduces the system location toggle for ChroemOS,

which deprecates the ARC-specific location toggle. ARC toggle reflects

the state of the ChromeOS location toggle.



When user reinstalls the Play Store they need to configure the default

location state for it. As there's no such thing as ARC-specific

location, users will now configure the ChromeOS location state instead.



Update ToS text to include ChromeOS and tie the location checkbox to

`kUserGeolocationAccessLevel`.

entry.title: [Blink] Have VideoCaptureImpl get texture target from ClientSI
entry.content:
As part of eliminating gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget() in favor of clients

calling ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(), this CL changes

VideoCaptureImpl from calling

GpuVideoAcceleratorFactories::ImageTextureTarget() to instead get the

texture target directly from the SharedImage that it creates.



The one production implementation of ImageTextureTarget() [1] that is

used in this context calls through to gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget(),

passing the client-specified buffer format and a hardcoded buffer

usage. Hence, we pass the same buffer format and buffer usage here

(ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage, BufferFormat) is a

drop-in replacement for gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget()). We will

eliminate ImageTextureTarget() in a followup.



NOTE: BrowserGpuVideoDecodeAcceleratorFactories is also a production

subclass of GpuVideoAcceleratorFactories, but it is not used here as

this is renderer process code.

entry.title: Remove a few more vector<const T> in tests
entry.content:
See bug for context, e.g. comment 16.



In some cases, I made the vector const. In others, I just

removed it.



Some of the confusion here seems to be that people think a

span can only be created from a vector.

That's not the case: A span makes sense – it's a

readonly view into a series of elements. A vector

doesn't make much sense (you can just assign to the vector

a new vector with an element removed or replaced), and a

vector converts to a span just fine.



No behavior change.

entry.title: Update System Profile in crashpad
entry.content:
This change makes Chrome's metrics service update the System Profile

stored in crashpad when an updated version is created.



Currently, only the first version is attached to crashpad, resulting in

fields that take longer to collect (e.g., antivirus data, which is

collected in a separate process) frequently being missing from crash

reports. This was done due to a limitation in the Crashpad API, which

has been updated as of crrev.com/c/5260024.



With this change, later updates to the SystemProfile, e.g., the one by

`metrics::MetricsService::OnFinalLogInfoCollectionDone`, which happens

after antivirus data and other fields are collected, will also be

reflected in crash reports.



Bug: b/308999458

entry.title: Add feature - no fake GDI init
entry.content:
Fake GDI init interceptions allow gdi32.dll (and by extension, anything

that depends on it like user32.dll and shell32.dll) to load in a process

that has the win32k lockdown mitigation applied.



This feature removes the interceptions, so the dlls can't be loaded.



Retail chrome mostly works under this feature, there will be follow

up changes to fix the few remaining issues. There is a spec in the

bug.

entry.title: SQL: Make sql::Transaction hold WeakPtr<Database>
entry.content:
Now, Transaction checks whether the Database has been destroyed before

using it.



This CL also adds stricter sequence checking to Database, which found a

few places that Database was passed between sequences:



(1) storage::DatabaseTracker was using and destroying sql::Database on

different sequences. Now, it simply destroys the Database instance

in storage::DatabaseTracker::Shutdown(), which already runs on the

correct sequence.



(1) history::InMemoryDatabase was "slurping" data from disk on one

sequence, then querying the data on a different sequence. To support

this use case, we added added sql:Database::DetachFromSequence().

Now, InMemoryDatabase effectively annotates the cut point where the

Database is handed off to another sequence.



Bug: 326498393

entry.title: Improve Attribution Internals styling and accessibility
entry.content:
- Use lighter background and normal font weight for table headers and

footers

- Stick sort arrows to right side of table header cells for consistent

location regardless of line breaks

- Use consistent arrow characters (previously one was an emoji)

- Use and for row count in table footers

- use CSS variables to make it easier to share properties across rules

- Wrap tables in a
that captures overflow scrolling so that the

scrollbar appears immediately below the table instead of at the

bottom of the page when the table's height is less than 100%

- Add aria-labelledby attributes to relevant elements

- Align table cells to left and top for easier eye-tracking

- Remove extra margin from 
 (used to format code blocks)



Screenshots of changes in http://crbug.com/327473301#comment2.

entry.title: [mullet m2] Eliminate technical debt in label generation
entry.content:
There are now two sources for the labels:

1. `AutofillSuggestionGenerator`: Handles adding granular filling labels

("Fill full name", "Fill full address").

2. `AutofillProfile`: Handles adding any label which is profile related

(name, address, email, etc.).



Before this CL, profile related labels where also added sometimes by

`AutofillSuggestionGenerator`.



Adding differentiating labels is completely handled by

`AutofillProfile`, so the logic which used to handle this in

`AutofillSuggestionGenerator` was deleted.



Since no more profile related labels are added by

`AutofillSuggestionGenerator`, there is no need to exclude any field

types from label generation (except for the triggering field's type).



A test which tested for adding correct "Fill full name - differentiating

label" label was deleted, as it is actually impossible to have a

differentiating label after the "Fill full name" label. The test could

do this by skipping part of the code logic.



Demo: http://go/scrcast/NDkyODA3MjAyMDEzMTg0MHw5N2VkODRjNC1hYg



Bug: 1459990

Change-Id: Ic0c4858c6663ef7a8ab23c8b7099916cadd4d407

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5198212

entry.title: Move all FlatBuffer TabState saves until after deferred startup
entry.content:
Currently FlatBuffer TabState saves which occur immediately after

a legacy TabState save can happen before deferred startup. This

risks an increase in Jank. This change moves these saves from before

deferred startup until after deferred startup by integrating with the

rest of the FlatBuffer migration infrastructure.



Bug: b:327509170

entry.title: Refactor the decoration computation in DecorationLinePainter
entry.content:
Let GetRectForTextLine() be the basis for all other computations of the

geometry of a decoration line. Rename it to DecorationRect().



Also pass an AutoDarkMode to PaintWavyTextDecoration rather than

creating a new instance, to show that they should be the same.



Bug: 40887872

entry.title: Remove the CSSSpellingGrammarErrors flag
entry.content:
The feature has been enabled since M121 with no bug reports

or issues. There are no open spec issues either.



Removing the flag makes additional work on highlights easier.
